articles.title: Not Your Average Joe’s to close Watertown location after 27 years
articles.description:
The longtime Watertown Square location will close Feb. 11.

The post Not Your Average Joe’s to close Watertown location after 27 years appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Not Your Average Joe's will close its Watertown location on February 11.
The restaurant has served the community for 27 years.
Local residents will lose a popular dining option in Watertown Square.

articles.title: Ayer man accused in racist confrontation hit with new charges tied to boat vandalism
articles.description:
David McPartlan is being held at the Worcester County House of Correction after having his bail revoked.

summary: David McPartlan faces new charges for boat vandalism in addition to previous racist confrontation allegations.

articles.title: Rhode Island’s last ski area faces an existential threat: No snow
articles.description:
The Yawgoo Valley Ski Area Yawgoo opened its doors in 1965. At the time, there were four other ski areas in the state.

The post Rhode Island’s last ski area faces an existential threat: No snow appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Yawgoo Valley Ski Area, Rhode Island's last ski area, opened in 1965.
Currently, Yawgoo faces existential threats due to insufficient snowfall.
Closure could impact Boston residents' access to nearby winter sports.

summary: Massachusetts' top Super Bowl snack is revealed through Google search data analysis.

articles.title: Trump shares racist video that depicts the Obamas as apes
articles.description:
Amid a flurry of criticism, the White House responds, “Please stop the fake outrage."

The post Trump shares racist video that depicts the Obamas as apes appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Trump shared a racist video on social media, sparking local outrage in Boston.
The White House dismissed criticism, stating, 'Please stop the fake outrage.'
Local leaders express concern over racial tensions in the community following the incident.
